summary: The Department of Homeland Security invests billions of dollars each year in new technologies such as facial recognition software, X-ray equipment, surveillance aircraft, and U.S. Coast Guard ships. We looked at how DHS tests and evaluates technologies to ensure they work before deploying them. The agency has strengthened its policies, guidance, and training to encourage testing and evaluation earlier in the acquisition process. We recommended...
title: Homeland Security Acquisitions: Opportunities Exist to Further Improve DHS's Oversight of Test and Evaluation Activities
